lead_paragraph: American Airlines Faces Problems From Plane Crash Before Flight 587 crashed, American Airlines was seen as one of the carriers best positioned to weather the drastic downturn that came after September's terrorist attacks. But now -- depending on what is determined to have caused the crash -- American could find itself in much deeper trouble, experts said. The best that American can hope for is that the crash turns out to be an accident, and even then it could be severely harmed. American has had a higher number of fatal accidents than its competitors in recent years. Another one could harden the impression that the airline has a safety problem. Investors punished the company's stock, sending its shares down $1.64, or 9 percent, to $16.49. [Page D10.]
